title: *HELP* Mac book pro FPS issues
body:
Hello,

So recently my Mac book pro’s hard drive failed on me so I ended up buying a new one. This was my chance to buy an SSD, yay. Since the installation of my ssd I had to back up my files which I had not done since last summer. So i restored a bunch old stuff. So now when I play LoL I begin to have FPS issues. it goes from 72 down 13 or even lower at times. I tried just about everything on the support section for FPS issues. I can run the game on very low graphics but even the fps kinda jumps around, but it isn’t that bad. I just don’t understand why I can no longer play on my old settings, medium graphics, without having fps issues. any tips will help. I also tried cutting out the sound for the game still FPS problems. I did SMC reset, PRAM rest etc.. I also tried repairing the client, I tired uninstalling  the client and downloading it again. I will post my specs down low. Any help would be awesome. I really love playing this game and I would hate to stop playing it because of some fps issue.

MacBook Pro (13-inch, Early 2011)
Processor 2.3 GHz Intel Core i5
Memory 8GB 1333 MHz DDR3
Graphics Intel HD Graphics 3000 512 MB
OSX El Capitan Version 10.11.5
 Samsung V-NAND SSD 850 EVO 500GB

Thank you for your time!

replies.body: Since you've already taken a lot of great first steps to get this resolved, I recommend reaching out to our tech specialists [in a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). Be sure to include a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#section-mac) so they have all the information to get this resolved quickly and efficiently.
